<<<<<<< HEAD
Humors looking glasse Humors antique faces. Selections Rowlands, Samuel, 1570?-1630? Rowlands, Samuel, 1570?-1630? Letting of humors blood in the head-vaine. Selections. aut
[32] p.
Imprinted by Ed. Allde for VVilliam Ferebrand and are to be sold at his shop in the popes-head Pallace, right ouer against the Tauerne-dore, London : 1608.
Dedication signed: Samuel Rowlands. In verse. Largely composed of selections from his "Humors antique faces" and the 1607 edition of "Humors ordinarie", an expanded edition of "The letting of humors blood in the head-vaine". Signatures: A-D⁴. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

Largely composed of selections from his "Humors antique faces" and the 1607 edition of "Humors ordinarie", an expanded edition of "The letting of humors blood in the head-vaine". Signatures: A-D⁴.
